Authors:
Altielys Casale Magnago, Genivaldo Alves-Silva, Terry
Henkel, Rosa Mara Borges da Silveira
Title:
New Boletaceae taxa from Brazil: Brasilioporus
olivaceoflavidus and B. simoniarum gen. et spp. nov., Neotropicomus
australis gen. et sp. nov., and Nevesoporus nigrostipitatus gen. et sp.
nov., and new combinations for the Guyanese Xerocomus parvogracilis,
Tylopilus rufonigricans and Tylopilus exiguus
Keywords:
Agaricomycetes, Boletales, Boletoideae, boletes,
multilocus phylogeny, Neotropics, taxonomy, 7 new taxa.
Abstract:
Brasilioporus olivaceoflavidus gen. et sp. nov.,
Brasilioporus simoniarum sp. nov., Neotropicomus australis gen. et. sp.
nov., and Nevesoporus nigrostipitatus gen. et sp. nov (Boletaceae,
Boletales, Basidiomycota) are described from tropical forests of Brazil.
New combinations of the Guyanese taxa Xerocomus parvogracilis into
Neotropicomus, Tylopilus rufonigricans into Brasilioporus, and Tylopilus
exiguus into Nevesoporus are also proposed. Boletaceae subfamily
Chalciporoideae was re-circumscribed to include the new genus
Nevesoporus. Specimens of the new taxa were collected in the Atlantic
Forest of eastern Brazil, an endangered, globally important biome for
tropical biodiversity. Molecular phylogenetic analyses using a
multi-locus dataset (ITS+28S+TEF1+RPB1+RPB2) from a large taxon set
across the Boletaceae justify erection of the new genera.
Macromorphological, micromorphological, habitat, and multilocus DNA
sequence data are provided for the new species. A key to the known
native and introduced bolete species from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest
is provided.
